alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 12:09PM MST until July 28 at 2:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pinal. * WHEN...Until 315 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Some low-water crossings may become impassable and ponding of water in other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1206 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1.5 inches of rain has fallen in the higher terrain east of State Route 77 near and north of Dudleyville. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over parts of the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dudleyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
